scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-2012-BLG-0563L Exoplanetary System


Overview

OGLE-2012-BLG-0563L is a star with 0.34 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 4240.03 light years away from the solar system.

OGLE-2012-BLG-0563L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the OGLE-2012-BLG-0563L system


OGLE-2012-BLG-0563L b

OGLE-2012-BLG-0563L b was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2015-08, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 0.74 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2012-BLG-0563L b is 124.020 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2012-BLG-0563L b is 13.600 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-2012-BLG-0563L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system OGLE-2012-BLG-0563L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the OGLE.
name: OGLE-2012-BLG-0563L - System With 1 Exoplanet
